page.title: 09Housing in Bacup
page.content: The housing in our area is mainly of the terraced type. Some houses have just been built but most of them are old. A lot of the houses are council houses but now people are buying them. There are not as many flats as there used to be, they have been turned into houses. The housing in Bacup is not all at its best,for instance half of one estate road is having to be done up. People still live in some of the poor houses. Builders have been working on the houses for about two years, putting slates on roofs and new windows in. The council told us that the cost is about Â£10,000 per property and each takes 10_11weeks to finish. Some of the cost is paid by the Department of the Environment. It gives work to local plasterers,joiners electricians and plumbers.
